name: dozily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows someone is tired and wants to sleep: Martin slept through it all - rolling over dozily when she tried to wake him. She told herself dozily that she mustn't fall asleep.
UK in a way that shows that someone is slow to think or react, or is not very intelligent: I gazed rather dozily at the teacher, unable to pretend I had a clue what she was talking about. See
dozy
More examplesFewer examplesThe baby would sit dozily in her pram until the sun went down.She spent most of the day gazing dozily at the kitchen fire.What I hadn't anticipated, rather dozily, was that I would need my passport for the flight.
